itemDescription: professor of astrophysics and space science

wikipedia_page.main: Martin Barstow is a Professor of Astrophysics and Space Science at the Department of Physics and Astronomy at the University of Leicester and the former President of the Royal Astronomical Society.

response: Southwood retired from ESA during 2011 and returned to Imperial College. The same year, he stood for election as President of the Royal Astronomical Society, where he had previously served as vice-president from 1989–1991. He began his two-year tenure as president in May 2012, and served until May 2014 when he was succeeded by Martin Barstow.

link_mentions.page: President of the Royal Astronomical Society
